title: STT service
description: It was a project run in Ecount, to build a Speech-to-Text (STT) service using Whisper-1 model of OpenAI. It integrates into the graph node system of other AI services.

descriptionPartial.text: It was a project run in Ecount, to build a Speech-to-Text (STT) service using Whisper-1 model of OpenAI. It integrates into the graph node system of other AI services.

title: LSTM-MLP-based Korean Hate Speech Detection Using Pixel Coordinates of Image-Transformed Text and Vector Features
subtitle: 이미지화된 텍스트의 픽셀 위치 좌표와 벡터 특징을 활용한 LSTM-MLP 기반 한글 혐오 표현 탐지
description:
I proposed a model that extracts features using two differenct feature extractors, concatenates the vectors, and then understands the sentences through a dense layer.
I used two types of feature data: one is the feature vectorized through embedding in the traditional way and interpreted through an LSTM extractor, and the other is the feature extracted through MLP by utilizing the index representing the pixel position where the text is located as coordinates by converting the text into an image.

descriptionPartial.text:
I proposed a model that extracts features using two differenct feature extractors, concatenates the vectors, and then understands the sentences through a dense layer.
I used two types of feature data: one is the feature vectorized through embedding in the traditional way and interpreted through an LSTM extractor, and the other is the feature extracted through MLP by utilizing the index representing the pixel position where the text is located as coordinates by converting the text into an image.

For example, just like the image above, the text '정말' has been converted into an image in grey scale, with black background which has the value of '0'. Index of the pixel which has the value greater than '0' will be used as the feature for MLP.

The experimental results show that the LSTM model, which uses only vector feature data extracted from text as input, achieved an F1-score of 86.85% on the plain text test dataset and an F1-score of 82.51% on the test dataset containing special characters. By comparison, the proposed LSTM-MLP model, which uses both vector feature data and coordinate feature data, achieved an F1-score of 88.13% on the plain text test dataset and an F1-score of 85.98% on the test dataset containing special characters.

title: RAG LLM Automation
description: Built a LLM automation using LangChain.Developed a RAG model that answers based on real existing data with natural language processing input, and also built an automated LLM model that can retrieve data from the database.

descriptionPartial.text: Built a LLM automation using LangChain. Developed a RAG model that answers based on real existing data with natural language processing input, and also built an automated LLM model that can retrieve data from the database.
LangChain was quite new to the world, so I learned it from scratch. I even built a memory system in the RAG automation pipeline manually, by feeding several conversation threads into the model.

I not only built the RAG model, but also created an automated LLM model that can retrieve data from the database. This involved setting up the necessary infrastructure and ensuring seamless integration with existing systems. In these days it is called Text-to-SQL model.

It had a little problem in the model's accuracy, showing the phenomenon so called hallucination. General prompting not have seemed to be the solution, so I took a chance to implement a Named Entity Recognition (NER) method to improve the accuracy of the LLM model. By recognizing and extracting specific entities from the input text, the NER data helped to provide more structured and relevant information to the LLM, thereby reducing hallucination by 50-60% and improving overall performance.

title: Pubty
description: It is a pub searching mobile application, which allows you to customize filters to find pubs that suit your preferences. You can search for pubs based on various criteria such as location, ambiance, drink menu, and more. The app provides detailed information about each pub, including reviews and ratings from other users.

descriptionPartial.text: It is a pub searching mobile application, which allows you to customize filters to find pubs that suit your preferences. You can search for pubs based on various criteria such as location, ambiance, drink menu, and more. The app provides detailed information about each pub, including reviews and ratings from other users.
I am building this application just because I wanted to have my own secret pub list with good vibes, that I can take friends to for a spare time to have a small chat and drinks.

title: OpenFrame Refactor
description: It was a project aimed at SaaS-ifying the solution while working at TmaxSoft. I was responsible for UI development in this project, specifically for the frontend development of the Portal and Console.

title: DatasetManager
description: I developed the frontend of a product that helps manage datasets in an open environment corresponding to the Mainframe's dataset.

descriptionPartial.text: I developed the frontend of a product that helps manage datasets in an open environment corresponding to the Mainframe's dataset.

contribution: Mainly focused on building reusable components and UI elements, which reduced development time for new pages by 30%
Pioneered to adopt Next.js and React-query, spreading know-how to the team
